name: Reverse Nordic Curl
how_to_perform:
1. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward and your arms extended.
2. Bend your knees slightly and lean forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
3. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine.
4. From this position, flex your elbow to curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms still.
5. Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position, but do not return directly under control - pause for a moment before lower.
6. Repeat on the other side.
short_summary: Reverse Nordic Curl is an isolation exercise that targets the brachialis muscle and surrounding areas with varying degrees of involvement from adjacent muscles like the biceps brachii and pectoralis major.
